website_summaries.verdict: The best computer fan that draws a large amount of air in for better internal cooling.
pros: Large surface area sucks in air over a bigger area
Fan bearings keep the blades spinning smoothly and quietly
Easy to install and set up with most computer cases
cons: LED colors require a clear view of the outside to be seen inside a computer case

customer_reviews.title: The fan itself seems okay but..
customer_reviews.text: One fan came with one of the corner mounts broken, not surprising as there was zero shipping protective material inside the package. The fans also shipped with what I can only assume were the wrong screws. This was my first PC fan replacement so I don't know much about them, but the screws provided were only about 1/4 inch long and too wide to thread through the corner holes. No other mounting screws came. I found my old mounting bolts after an hour of searching and mounted it that way. The fan itself is quiet and seems to move a lot of air, but the overall experience of this purchase is definitely 1-star.
customer_reviews.author: Dedrith

customer_reviews.title: Great fans for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality which you come to expect from Corsiar. The leds are bright but not over the top and move alot of air. Even on full power the fans are pretty quite. The 140s ar ethe fans to get if your case supports them over the 120s cause can move the same amount of air of a 120 but at lower speeds thus being quiter. Can't go wrong with Corsair, in my opinion one of the best in PC market.
customer_reviews.author: Lance D

customer_reviews.title: Keep it cool
customer_reviews.text: My In Win 301 White Tempered Glass Micro-ATX Computer Case didn't come with fans, so I installed these puppies in the case. Works great. No issues. Love the white LED, which goes well with the white case. Keeps my computer cool. Just make sure to assemble the fans correctly. I have one installed blowing air in, and on the opposite side, blowing the air out. Wish these Corsair would provide more detailed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: MarkUS

customer_reviews.title: Great fan at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to use as a side panel intake fan over my GPU in my CoolerMaster n400 case. Fan is nice and quiet and moves a good amount of air. I expect this to help lower GPU temperatures over extended gaming sessions. I'm using this in conjunction with a Silverstone fan extension to make removal of the side panel easier. I have used other corsair fans in my systems (ML120s & SP120s) and must say I was disapointed to see this fan does not have any rubber vibration dampening going on at the fan mounts, but for the price of the fan I can over look this. So far I'm quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Simple 3 pin fans, great for a static Color.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with these fans at all. Exactly as I wanted my fans to be. I was looking at corsair and Thermaltake, and I just wanted the easiest fans as possible. While PWM does sound interesting, I wasn't concerned with that level of granular fan implementation on my Desktop Build. I just wanted speed control, with a static amazing light show. So I bought the blue fan you see here, and i can control its speed from my ASUS motherboard Bios after plugging it into my motherboard 4 pin fan pins. Yes, this fan is 3 pin however. Great simple fans, would recommend them to everybody.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Luc Hayes

customer_reviews.title: They are really great fans!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these fans for my newest build rocking a Ryzen 5 2600 and a EVGA GTX1080 FTW Andy man these all look great together . These are super quiet and look fantastic at the same time . They use 3pin headers and the side with the larger Corsair logo sucks in air so the “pretty side of the fan is inside the case but for the 2nd fan in the front I just peeled the front sticker off and put it over the back sticker so that I don’t have to see all the ugly lettering from the fan pulling air into the Case at the front . Will definitely buy again if I need more fans!
customer_reviews.author: Nick DeLaRosa

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to a budget build for my nieces
customer_reviews.text: I like this LED fan. It has bright red LEDs and the fan is somewhat quiet. The Asus motherboard that I used for the build is able to adjust the fan speed with software included with the mobo and with the BIOS on the Asus motherboard. It appears to be well made and since it uses LEDs, I guess it will last a long time. The LEDs are not built into the fan blades, but into the sides. The LEDs are fixed when the fans spin. Since the price was right, I bought a two-pack, and my nieces love their i5 CPU computer. The prices was great too. I would recommend these fans to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. DUARTE

customer_reviews.title: Not Silent, But BOY Do They Cool My Rad
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my loud, non-illuminated fans in my content creation workstation to sandwich my CPU water cooling radiator. If you can keep them around 50%, you can hardly hear them, and honestly even at 100% they're not loud, but you'll definitely tell the difference when they spool down. Corsair hits the mark again, especially if you're like me and hate spending a huge amount of money on fans. The lights are just bright enough to make my HP Z420 workstation look cool, but not bright enough to keep my neighbors awake all night.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: NOT Quiet fans
customer_reviews.text: Shame on you Corsair. I own some of your other products and was disappointed when I connected the AF120 fans. IMHO, these may be the noisiest 120mm fans I've ever heard and I've been building desktop PC systems for decades. I returned these and got 2 Antec fans from amazon that ARE so quiet, you have to look at them to make sure they are running!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Died after two weeks of normal home-office use
customer_reviews.text: I installed the fan the correct way so it would be an exhaust fan on my computer. It worked just fine for about two weeks, now it seems to be stuck and makes a clicking noise when it's trying to work. I have to turn the fan speed up just for it to turn on, but when it's on, it is SO loud! They are not quiet fans at all, so just remember that. They initially work well, but then end up failing on you. This is my third one that I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Dougietin1

customer_reviews.title: Corsair makes great products
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked Corsair products, and this one is no different. If the motor makes any sound, I can't hear it over the sound of the air that this fan pushes. It doesn't match because Amazon sent me the wrong color, but it's a great fan. The screws that come in the box are too big. You could probably force them to work, but if you have any screws laying around(like the ones that came out of the fan you're most likely replacing) those work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS AN OFF COLOR OF WHITE!
customer_reviews.text: Fan is awesome, silent, works great, BUT ITS AN OFF COLOR!. Bought a Corsair case that came with two fans and i needed a third. Figured of i'll buy the same model, color, size ect. it's the same. No, no it is not. This white is not the same white my case came with and it bugs the crap out of me. If you're getting this as an additional fan for ones you already have, beware!
customer_reviews.author: Drjeebus

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing silent about these fans. They do an ok job at fanning compared to others. The LED (blue) is nice and just the right brightness. Not too bright and not too dim. Ordered two. One is making a grinding noise. Ordered a replacement. New one is also making a grinding noise. Tried different cables, different PSU and a different case. Still grinding. The fan construction as a whole is quite cheap. You get four short screws. Screw holes are self tapping.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Choice for Quiet and Cooling Efficiency
customer_reviews.text: An excellent fan and addition to my i7 6700K build. Works very quietly and efficiently in tandem with the rest of my 8 case fans. I like the subtle illumination the white LEDs produce in my case - In Win GRone White Steel ATX Full Tower Case. Even at full speed, I can barely hear this fan - I like that, especially when I am recording or live streaming my gameplay. Would I recommend this product? Most certainly I do.
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: Ripped off!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the twin pack of these fans, but the reason I am leaving three stars is because the twin pack is under 140mm. So you would assume I would get two 140mm fans, but no I got two 120mm fans. The fans are okay the color isn't to bright, but it doesn't matter because if you want neutral airflow you will most like have to turn the fans backwards so no light will be going into your system. They barley move air as well. I would recommend for a normal PC with a little flair, but not for a gaming PC. Spend your money else where. DON'T GET RIPPED OFF.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Way

customer_reviews.title: LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I still give it 3 stars because when you buy 2 case fans for only 18 bucks you really can't complain about what you receive. I only wanted these because my entire build is corsair themed so I just wanted something affordable and that matched my theme. But considering that they advertise these as SILENT is a joke. These things get loud when on max speed and my SP120 performance fans are way quieter than these which should be the opposite. My PC sounds like a jet engine on full load. I will be buying different fans to replace these but the only thing I like about these is the design.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: No regrets look great
customer_reviews.text: Look sweet, easy install being only 1 wire thats 3 pin versus the alternating RGB colored fans nowadays being 2 wires and requiring hubs, etc. Super simple and works, red LED looks awesome in my build. I have 2 120mm and 2 140mm of these. Refer to picture attached
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Two years later, they don't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these about 20 months ago and at this point one of them has become extremely noisy to the point I've had to trash it and the LEDs have failed on one of the remaining three. Essentially for me I've at a greater than 25% failure rate in less than 2 years. Also note these do not have the fan direction indicated on them anywhere, which just adds insult to injury. Next time I'll get Noctua or BeQuiet.
customer_reviews.author: thisguy

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: These had a solid amount of good reviews, and obviously the LEDs were appealing, so I opted for the red and they definitely add flair to my rig and have very good air flow. FWIW: I used one of these fans as intake on the side and the other on the top of my case as exhaust to get a good uptake across my GPU. I bought the ModTek 4-Pin Molex to 4 x 3-Pin Fan Connector Cable in order to plug these two fans directly into my PSU and installation and operation was seamless.
customer_reviews.author: Namrezy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & Functional
customer_reviews.text: I used a couple of these fans in a computer I build in November, 2018. The workmanship was fine and there were not problems (easy installation). The fans move a good amount of air and are virtually silent. They do light up nicely, but I can't see that from the outside of my computer case, so not really impressed with that aspect. They've been running for about 6 month now with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pope

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang; Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 140mm and a 120mm for my NZXT S340 Elite, and I can't express how amazing this product is! Corsair does it again with quality products for a fair price. the LEDs look amazing in my case, and they were super easy to install. The screws require a good bit of force to get through the fan mounting holes which is a plus in my book, because I know it's snug. As far as noise goes, I can't hear them at all! Strongly recommend this for novice and experienced builders! I'll be purchasing another 2x140mm to replace my stock 120mm in the front!
customer_reviews.author: Hot Saauce

customer_reviews.title: Good. Quiet. Longer than average cord but no extra features or parts.
customer_reviews.text: I'd have to recommend these. I've never had LED lit fans before and while that was more of a bonus aside to me, it looks nice in the case (which has a clear side panel. Regarding the fans themselves, they are sturdy and well made. The cord coming off them are of a good length. I didn't check but they seemed longer than the other fans I have. But, I have Noctua NF-F12s for my radiator and it's worth nothing that these (Corsair AF120) fans didn't come with anything extra. Just the fan and a set of mounting screws. The NF-F12s, for contrast, came with rubber mounting grommets (and screws), extension cables, speed limiters and a power splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Villasenor

customer_reviews.title: They are quiet.
customer_reviews.text: So, I "re-did" my (old) Alienware Area 51 case. I gutted it and re-fit it with better hardware. I also got out the angle grinder and opened things up for some real cooling. I think these are really nice fans. They look good and I can't hear them. It could be that my older video card fans are drowning them out, but all I can hear is my GPU fan. Even when gaming I don't see many temps over 33C. Except that GTX 970...I'm overworking it....
customer_reviews.author: Reno Dave

customer_reviews.title: they work very well.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give them a few stars off bit it was my own fault. i ordered the wrong fans. these fans are 3 pin so they cannot be controlled like a cpu fan. these run at a set rpm that you set in your bios setting. my bad. but these fans do work very well so i gave 5 stars. they are quit at lower rpm. if you set them high they can be very noisy. i will suggest you go with a 4 pin if your motherboard offers more then one fan connection. this will keep the noise down and ramp up rpm if the case gets too hot.
customer_reviews.author: rexpeper

customer_reviews.title: Four LEDs and that is it.
customer_reviews.text: I have seen better LEDs fans. I build computers for a living and let me tell you that there is better out there if you want a good solid red all around led fan. If you are just looking for something quiet and durable then yes, this is a good choice with the bonus of the price and the LEDs. It is obvious that these fans had the LEDs added as an afterthought, to make sure they sell. The lights of the LEDs don't spread out evenly. It looks more like four tiny flashlights aiming at the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Dimitri Lopez

customer_reviews.title: As advertised - good value
customer_reviews.text: I have never gone wrong with Corsair fans and this is no exception. I purchased five of these and each fan running full speed by themselves is pretty much a whisper. With all five fans running full speed they are a little noisy but not overwhelmingly noisy. But with all five fans I can turn the speed down to about 600 700 RPMs and they have enough airflow to keep my case just slightly over ambient. The red LED glow isn't quite as bright as I would like but that's kind of what you expect from the color red because red seldom shows up very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Newman

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan, only connects to motherboard, harder to install than other fans.
customer_reviews.text: The fans work fine. They're quite, push quite a bit of air, and have a nice LED effect. However, they don't come with a connector to plug straight into the PSU like most fans and need to be plugged directly into the motherboard. People with smaller motherboards may not be able to support both fans without the purchase of an adapter that should be included with the fan. The screws that come with are prone to stripping very easily and in my experience these fans were harder to install than others I've used.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after a lot of research and thought. Bought these mainly for the amazing reviews and just to upgrade my loud, stock fans that came with my case. Very quiet and awesome fans for the money. I have 3 of these in my computer and they light up my case pretty well. No complaints and would recommend for anyone looking to replace their stock, loud case fans with some nice LED fans.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my PC
customer_reviews.text: I was having airflow issues with my PC so decided to add a fan to the front. This was a custom install so was not straight forward. The fun worked great though and provided the air I needed. The red lighting is nice. I don’t care for it that much I was just looking for a good fan at a good price and this was it. The fan can get quite noisy. For the most part I wear a headset so I don’t hear it and no one has ever heard it in the background in my microphone.
customer_reviews.author: John Travaglini

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than a regular Corsair AF fan?
customer_reviews.text: This fan made a lot more sense when my build was in the red H440 case, but after moving the build into the Enthoo Evolv ATX TG, this fan now sits unused in the back of the H440 still. That said, it was a nice upgrade over the NZXT stock fan that was in the rear as an exhaust, and the red LED was a nice touch with the red and black case. Those of you with red themes will like this fan as an exhaust.
customer_reviews.author: David T. Kreal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance and Appearance, Especially for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I mounted these two fans onto my Cooler Master Hyper 212 Evo, and I must say I'm extremely impressed by their performance. Very quiet, very efficient, and a fantastic appearance to boot. I really can't believe how cheap these fans are given how they look and how well they work in a push-pull configuration. They attached easily to the Cooler Master Hyper 212 Evo, and improved the temperature by an additional 10-12 degrees Celsius compared to the fan included with the Hyper 212. All in all, I highly recommend these fans for anyone who is looking to improve the air flow in their case or on their CPU cooler, as well as add some pleasant red LED lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Byzantine Bananas

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and nice looking!
customer_reviews.text: I've built around 50 computers over the last 20 years for myself, friends, and family. I always just bought whatever cheap $30 case that was on sale. One day several years ago I bought a nice case and wow... a quite computer case is a beautiful thing. And I am more than happy spending extra money on quiet fans. These fit the bill!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good brand bad product
customer_reviews.text: As much as I like corsair these fans are unfortunately a huge let down they barely made it a year before they started making a bunch of noise like Clank who skips kind of like there's sand in the blade somewhere keep in mind I do keep my computer very clean and clean it out every two months inside out so the fans barely even have any dust on them but they don't run for long they are very cheap
customer_reviews.author: Apollo Smile

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Bearing Quality - not even 6 month lifetime
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in January 2020, and at time of writing, it's 5/24/2020. I bought these fans as a replacement for a stock NZXT fan in my tower that had gone bad in my PC (bad bearing, causing lots of noise). One now failed today. Immediately ordering another set of fans from a different company. Not about to wait until the other one starts making a hideous sound as well. Never buying corsair fans again, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Brennen S.

customer_reviews.title: The LED fans look absolutely amazing when I installed them
customer_reviews.text: The LED fans look absolutely amazing when I installed them. It definitely makes my PC glow more so. I did however have one issue but it's really minor. One of the fans did not work when I installed them but was able to get another replacement in. I am very pleased with this overall purchase. The fans are pretty quiet in the environment I'm in and can definitely feel a much better airflow through my PC. I would definitely recommend getting these fans to those looking to upgrade or build their PC.
customer_reviews.author: Oodama Rasengan

customer_reviews.title: Solid fans, good deal
customer_reviews.text: The fans glow a nice red, each one coming with separate mounting screws.Im running 4 of them , and they all are spinning with no issues.As for brightness, they emit just the right amount - no more - no less.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: I love these fans!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 fans total. Easy to install, case fan screws worked perfect. Did not strip out and are easily installed without a problem. My computer is much quieter than what it was before by far! I replaced my old Cooler Master fans with these, because these actually pushed more air and stated they were quiet compared to my old ones. The red l.e.d lights on the case fans are bright, but not too bright. They are very true to their color as well. My side panel on my case is smoked plexi-glass, so I can see the light, but it's not blinding. Overall, I highly recommend these fans for if you need to get new ones that are quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cook

customer_reviews.title: READ ALL THE WAY.
customer_reviews.text: So I was excited to get these and install them on my new build but as others have mentioned the screws that come with the fans dont fit them. What the heck. 5/17/19. I was wrong! These screws form the shape in the fans. You just gotta put some good old elbow grease on it as you screw them in for the first time. After you screw them all the way they come out and back in EASY! Looking good fan, looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Order the harness
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the twin pack to replace case fans in my wife's gaming computer. Fans are very quiet, and are well worth the money. However, if you are not familiar will connecting the fans into the motherboard, then spend the extra money on the harnesses. If you are up for the challenge, your motherboard indicates where the fans are to be plugged in. Be aware that plugging into the main control board will pull a little power from your operating speed (just a little), but if you have a fast system you may not notice the change. I gave 4 stars for durability but honestly how can you quantify durability after just two months use? These fans are a sound purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang; Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 140mm and a 120mm for my NZXT S340 Elite, and I can't express how amazing this product is! Corsair does it again with quality products for a fair price. the LEDs look amazing in my case, and they were super easy to install. The screws require a good bit of force to get through the fan mounting holes which is a plus in my book, because I know it's snug. As far as noise goes, I can't hear them at all! Strongly recommend this for novice and experienced builders! I'll be purchasing another 2x140mm to replace my stock 120mm in the front!
customer_reviews.author: Hot Saauce

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable, runs 24/7 since 2016!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for my feeder mice since 2016... and it runs 24/7. I still have the second fan unused ad a back-up. It's now 2019 and still running strong, even the LED lights are still working. I'd without a doubt purchase this again, and highly recommend to anyone who needs a little air flow. By adding one of these to my mouse cage it causes moisture to evaporate meaning less smell and fewer cleanings.
customer_reviews.author: MudDan

customer_reviews.title: A good fan is like buying good salt.
customer_reviews.text: The fan is such a common item for computers as long as they work and are quite one pays little attention to them. I recieved two of these in November and installed one that same day and it has been trouble free. What more can I say. The other one is just a spare. I would recommend these fans.
customer_reviews.author: F. Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: to actually cool the inside of your pc when dealling with really ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay fan, but becarefull as this is not that powerfull even at full speeds, I will say though if you want quiet, this can get really quiet, but at the price of really low speeds. Still this is worth a look, and if you have water cooling, enough space, this can be used with more fans, you know, to actually cool the inside of your pc when dealling with really hot weathers, like what I'm experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: High airflow.
customer_reviews.text: Installed as top exhaust on my mid ATX tower. I’m not sure why corsair calls it “quiet edition” cause it’s louder than my 2 other fans and cx750m power supply combined. The main front Corsair logo pulls air in and out the back. The back is why the info is printed. This is meant to install as an front intake being you get frontal on the RGB red light and the Corsair logo if it were to even show.
customer_reviews.author: justin webb

customer_reviews.title: Great LED Case Fans
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace my two year old Antec TriCool 120mm fans in my Cooler Master Elite 130. These are definitely an improvement in the looks department and perform just as well. My Antec fan had a three speed switch (silent, Not that loud, and Loud) and this Corsair fan seems to be as loud as the medium setting on the Antec. I just wish Corsair made some 80mm versions so i could replace my other smaller fan. I took a photo of the fan inside my case but it doesn't look as bright as they do in person.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: Push a good amount of air & are silent, awesome fans at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: They push good air and are very silent. They also have a nice LED light that is noticeable. Overall you cannot want anything more at this price. The cord was long enough to put them in the front, top or back and reach the Fan controller or motherboard easily. See the video and you can not hear anything on these fans. Corsair is really high quality, I am more than impressed by these at this price compared to other companies that charge more for the same or less quality fans.
customer_reviews.author: Pharticus Maximus Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Decent fan, quiet. LED color is mismatched from other corsair products.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't move nearly as much air as the SP120 magnetic fan. However, it does the job. My biggest complaint is the white color is slightly off from the white color of ALL the other corsair products. Almost everything in my case is corsair and glows white. This fan stands out because it has a bluish tint to the color. Somewhat annoyed about that. Come on corsair, get the color right it's not that hard.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Well...it is NOT quiet
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with this fan. I have a 120mm quiet edition and bought this because of the LEDs but ended up hating it after a couple of days because of the constant buzz. NOT QUIET at all. Performance is good, actually very good since it does a good job on that regard but can't stand the noise. It could be I got a bad apple but after reading several people saying the same I think it is a production issue
customer_reviews.author: I. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Yes, that describes it perfectly! This ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Yes, that describes it perfectly! This cooler are so silent I have to look at my PC to check they are spinning and I have 4 of them installed on a Carbide SPEC 01, you won't hear them. My computer is literally beside me, no noise at all. These things are expensive enough to have made the price of the case go twice what it was, but really worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jovao do Santos

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and long lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and it worked very quietly at max RPM. Update after 8 months almost at 9 months. The bearings went bad on the fan. I woke up in the morning and turned on my computer to find that the bottom fan was making a vibration sound. It scared me so bad because I thought it was my hard drive. Then I just noticed it was the fan. It worked great I wil, be buying another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Not so Quiet for a Quiet edition.
customer_reviews.text: One fan arrived out of alignment- the other one worked fine but was significantly louder than the stock fan i planned on replacing. Fin material seems a little flimsy. LED brightness was fine and the unit looks good in the case. Regardless of how good it looks in my case, low fan noise is my primary concern and this fan makes way too much noise. I am in the process of returning these and replacing with something quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Manny from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Not as quiet as you think !
customer_reviews.text: Although these fans are supposed to be "quiet" - they are not, especially if you aren't using a speed control with them. They make quite a bit of noise when running full bore so I would recommend that you either have them on an RPM controlled line or you wire in a potentiometer so that you can set the speed at a point where they will be less noisy. The red LEDs are neat looking so the aesthetics of them are fine, no problem there.
customer_reviews.author: Darkstar7

customer_reviews.title: Red, Cool, Cheap, What more could you ask for in a case fan?
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these case fans! This is the second time I have bought the two pack and I can't talk enough about how well they work. Just to be clear these are NOT pvm fans, but ones with a 3 pin connector. I wanted constant airflow through my caseand these provide just that. I have a red and black theme going and these led fans are perfect for just that. The led's are bright, but not bright to the point where you wish you could turn them off. If you are looking for colored case fans I would highly suggest these to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Horne

customer_reviews.title: Love them and plan on buying more.
customer_reviews.text: Docked one star only because calling it "quiet" is missleading. It's definitely not one of the quietest fans but for the price, but having a build that can run ultra graphics, I love that these fans prioritize speed and keeping my system cool. I never have high temps even when running AAA games like the Witcher 3. However, when jdle, browsing, or just not using high graphic settings, these fans are near silent. Really perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Aven

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, super workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Okay, its not COMPLETELY whisper-quiet, but if it was, you'd probably be wondering if it was working at all! Its a fan - really good one at that. Arrived on time, and packaged well. I'm no computer whiz, but even I was able to install it with relative ease. I was more than happy to replace my off-brand Chinese fan that came with my computer when I purchased it. Best of all - the lights definitely add a little something to the ambiance around my tower.
customer_reviews.author: DComic

customer_reviews.title: Decent fan for price, Installation could be better
customer_reviews.text: Simple yet difficult installation. It’s straight forward in a sense that you plug it into the motherboard and screw it on the case. Before you mount it on the case, you need to create a spiral in the holes of the plastic material of the fans. Then you can remove the screws and re-screw it onto the case. This takes quite a bit of force, so just be careful when screwing. ——- The fans are audible but silent enough to where it shouldn’t be picked up by your microphone if you aren’t too close to your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Carl King

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine.......
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for my new build and they worked great didn’t have a single issue on the electrical side but install was a bit of a pain. They did not fit that well I could line up three holes at most and I had to force the last one in by bending my cases frame. Don’t know if it was the fault of the case or the fans but my 120mm fit just fine sooooo. Aside from that after getting them installed I never had an issue since
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Only sent one out of two fans, I have been bamboozled. Please send me my other fan
customer_reviews.text: You only sent me one fan. On the description page a customer asks the question if there were two or one fans and there were at least five or six responses that claimed there were two fans. Why would I pay $15 for one single color LED fan when I could buy an RGB fan for cheaper than that. Waste of my time to return item so I installed. The red LED is not very bright and the fan barely moves any air, reading says 1200 RPMs but my BIOS Show's it barely hits 1000. Will never buy Corsair fans again. Very happy I chose a thermaltake case over Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Fazio

customer_reviews.title: Good airflow, powerful LEDs
customer_reviews.text: I use these fans as intake fans for the front vents on my PC case. THE NOISE: These fans are reasonably quiet even at maximum RPM. THE AIRFLOW: They work very well and get nice circulation going throughout the case past the GPU and CPU. THE LEDs: Incredibly bright. Far brighter than I thought they were going to be, which isn't necessarily a bad thing. However, because of how bright they are it makes it incredibly difficult to leave my PC on overnight for downloads and the like. I have both of these installed in the front slots and it's like a little flashlight down there. Will probably replace eventually with ring LEDs.
customer_reviews.author: Ya boy

customer_reviews.title: The lighting is pretty slick. Nice and bright
customer_reviews.text: The lighting is pretty slick. Nice and bright, though with a very slight blue tint. Its not perfectly white, which I don't particularly mind. I can't score these higher though because of the noise. They are not particularly quiet. A lot of other reviews mention this issue but I choose them for look more than how quiet they are. Personally I think the sound level is pretty tolerable and if you play with the fan curve can probably get better acoustic performance out of these. But if you're looking for truly silent fans you might want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: DJRP

customer_reviews.title: Noisy at first.
customer_reviews.text: At 4.5 years old, I figured I would change my chassis fans as a maintenance task. I replaced four fans (two front, one side, one back) and plugged these into the motherboard Chassis fan ports. After first installation, they were obnoxiously loud. I read one review that likened it to a hair dryer. I used the mainboard manufacturer's Windows management software to regulate the fan speeds. The software isn't supported for Windows 10, but it works nonetheless. After some manipulation, the fans are now tolerably quiet, and can be set to ramp up with system demand.
customer_reviews.author: 🐱 Cat Slack Attack 🚀

customer_reviews.title: Great fans, no shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: These fans installed easily, looked great, and move a lot of air. I have no idea why some people complained about the power cord being to short, they were plenty long enough to reach any part of my midsize enermax case with plenty left over. The are good fans at a good price, with just the right amount of bling.
customer_reviews.author: M.B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very good fans.
customer_reviews.text: I place my order for two fans and before they came told my wife to go and pick me up a fan at one of the local pc store and the sell person show her where they where at and then she show then the fan that I had that was going bad, they told her that they would not install there fans in my case because the corsair fan that she show them was better than the ones that they sold unless I really needed one till mind come in. I was very please with them at the local pc store and I am going to be ordering a couple more for my other pc's.
customer_reviews.author: ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Lovely, Quiet and Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Quiet fans which are very lovely to look at and do their job very well. I have bought 4 red Corsairs for my case, and 4 blue for the computer I built for my wife. They're easy to install... make sure you understand your airflow needs in your case and you'll be good to go. If you're concerned about having enough fan connections on your mobo, check out JBtek All Black Sleeved PWM Fan Splitter Cable 1 to 2 Converter, 2 Pack ( They work very well also.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Fans but would be brighter
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality Corsair fans. That means something definitely feel a difference between a thermaltake fan and a Corsair. They are very quiet. My only gripe is that the LED's are not very bright for my use. Could be me but I was hoping for something that would shine a bit more. Other than that I am satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a pack of these fans as they have very good air flow but I found out they are very, very quiet as well which is a bonus. I never replaced a fan in my desktop computer before and I can tell you that it takes a few minutes (this also gives you the chance to clean out the dust bunnies out of your case).
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: not as quiet as I hoped, but great fans nonetheless
customer_reviews.text: they work, and my pc is a bit cooler having two front fans now, but they vibrate a lot against the case even when screwed in tightly so that's a bit annoying. They're cheap fans though and they work. If you're going to be wearing headphones or gaming a lot you won't even notice the noise anyway. The lights are nice too and I've noticed they get brighter or dimmer based on fan speed
customer_reviews.author: UwU

customer_reviews.title: only 1 out of the 2 worked after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: So, replaced default PC housing fans with these brands and they look great. Initially working with no problems. fast forward to 3 months, and only one of the two fans are working. would not recommend these to anyone... at first 5 stars, but with only 3 months of operations and a failure, got to replace them with another fan.
customer_reviews.author: Garnie In Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great fans but not that quiet when it hits maximum RPM
customer_reviews.text: These are fit really nicely with my red/black themed build. However, it's not really quiet when it reaches 100%, so if you don't have a 4-pin header fan, or a way to control these fans, then you will be annoyed fairly quickly. Disregarding the noise it makes, it does manage to cool down my entire rig fairly well paired up with the stock fan from the SPEC-01. My CPU stays at 25°C when doing normal word-processing and daily tasks if I set it to maximum while the GPU doesn't reach more than 45°C when its fans are not triggered.
customer_reviews.author: Víctor R.

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow fans for case cooling
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is intended for. Lowers temperatures for your computer components. I noticed a 2-3C drop after installing the fans compared to the stock case fans. Also, at 100% speed the fans aren't so quiet. But if you lower it to 60% speed from your BIOS or using a fan controller then it's very quiet. I got the blue LED model and it adds some nice ambient light into the PC case. I would recommend to anyone that wants quieter fans and cooler temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: dudebro7

customer_reviews.title: Great fans for those on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these inside my computer case. They work great, perform well, and look really cool. They replaced my aging Thermaltake red LED fans from 2011 and boy, what a difference! My old fans went out and would intermittently work. Once I got my new PSU plugged in, these were all easy to hook up. I went from having two case fans (though only one functioned) two three case fans and my PC runs super cool, at little more than a whisper's volume. Great product, low price. Can't go wrong!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Haight

customer_reviews.title: i love this fan.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this fan simply out of my personal need to keep my color scheme going in my gaming rig that i have in my corsair graphit series 780T the in case fan did not come led lit, the noise level is barley noticed, im talking less than a whisper at max speed. pros: it moves a lot of air (i mean its a 140mm fan so it should right?) its quiet, and it comes in other colors besides just red cons: it comes with fat screws so if i wanted to replace my front airflow fans with this one i would have to buy some more scres or mod my case so the included screws would fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo

customer_reviews.title: and they art beautiful! I am more than pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Although these are not as whisper quiet as fans that are double the price, I purchased two Noctua fans for 20 bucks a pop, a little over a year ago, and both have succumbed. (and lets face it you cannot showcase the cream and brown Noctua's unless your doing a cream n brown build...) No, they are not Noctua quiet, but I had used two 140mm versions of these fans in the build, and they are still spinning away.....so I purchased two of the 120mm to showcase the 240mm radiator I installed as an upgrade in the front of my Fractal Design "Define" R4 case, and they art beautiful! I am more than pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: J.T.U.

customer_reviews.title: Shop no more, this fan is best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Works great and quite as any fan on the market. Well built and sturdy. The only complaint i have is that no indication is on the fan as to what direction the fan spins. I have them mounted both vertically and horizontally and they work great. LED is not too bright but is a perfect balance.
customer_reviews.author: RangersFanatic

customer_reviews.title: if you have the extra money to spend I'd recommend purchasing rubber seals to place between the fans/case to ...
customer_reviews.text: AF120 LED Quiet Edition High Airflow Fan Twin Pack (White): Exactly what I expected and more. The LED bulbs are surprisingly bright and the fans are probably mid range if you're worried about sound, if you have the extra money to spend I'd recommend purchasing rubber seals to place between the fans/case to keep vibrations to a minimum. For the price, I cannot complain about sound levels though, and I would recommend buying these if you're in the market for 120mm fans for air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Brokido

customer_reviews.title: Price is great for two fans!
customer_reviews.text: Price is great for two fans. Using these two as replacements for one I had that was making clicking noises on boot and just loader than the other fans in general. Also replaced one on my heat sink. Corsair tower came with 3 red LED fans so I had to go with the red to complete the theme. For reference, I went to a local PC repair shop and they offered one Arctic 120mm fan for $20, so this was definitely the better choice. I would like to say that mine did not come with the air flow indicator arrows that are usually on the sides of the fans, but it's no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar M

customer_reviews.title: Don't think, just buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my stock case fans with a cheaper brand which turned out to be just as noisy as the originals. Not to mention the LED lights were also shared by the voltage channel, so when you reduced the RPMs the lights got dimmer. These Corsair's are PERFECT. Barely any noise running at full speed, they're super bright at lower RPMs, and I noticed a 3 degree drop in internal temperature. A+++
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: You want these!
customer_reviews.text: Its Corsair of course you want it! Been perfect and will be be perfect for a long time. I have never had a good quality Corsair fan die on me since I started using them a few years back. I used in a new server build, red was cheaper than white or no lights but pretty much all the same fan. If you keep them clean they will run longer than you will want to keep the case there in... lol. I have reused fans from Corsair from case to case until they no longer fit the new case or I sold the PC. Get Some!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good fans
customer_reviews.text: These fans clearly move a lot of air. I don't feel they're loud at all, but they're definitely not quiet. The light is very bright, but not annoyingly so. I replaced two of the case fans on my Antec 900 with these because they had died, but now I want to replace the others because the lights on these fans look nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Magnanti

customer_reviews.title: Quality is lacking, quiet though
customer_reviews.text: Both of these broke 3 years after I bought them. They worked great, up until they didn't. Quiet and look nice. Though, some side coverings for the LED lights would be nice. Not the level of quality I would expect from Corsair. Only buying again to match my build.
customer_reviews.author: Jak.grueneberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case fans
customer_reviews.text: These are quiet and move a lot of air. Installed a rx580 in my system and wanted more airflow to keep it cool. Using these as exhaust fans and they work great. The red is not overpowering, just give a nice ambient glow. Corsair quality... can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: John Stebbins

customer_reviews.title: Moving air, being cool, looking cool.
customer_reviews.text: I have battled thermal problems with a mATX PC in rough service for years. Finally installed everything in a new case and purchased the AF120 LED Quiet Edition to use as dual intake fans. They move a good amount of air and add a little jazz to the build. Internal temps have dropped across the board which should increase life of motherboard and components. Pretty happy with how it turned out.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: Needed a cheap red fan thats quiet because the one that came on the computer started making a loud annoying sound because it was kinda wobbly and this fixed it. Will have to buy another one for the other bad fan.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C.

customer_reviews.title: the lighting is nice matching colors of my case and inside cable sleeves
customer_reviews.text: I can't say more than enough with these Corsair fans. These in particular were bought to replace my Case stock fans to increase the air flow and reduce the heat inside the case. huge difference. the lighting is nice matching colors of my case and inside cable sleeves. They're pretty quiet even at nearly the max speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: UGH. One gripe. Sexy fans, though.
customer_reviews.text: What happened to indicator arrows for air flow direction? Come on, Corsair. Now that the negative is out of the way, let's move on. These fans are quiet (at least in my build), and they look good in a black and white setup. I have them in my Corsair 750D case attached to the Corsair H55 closed loop cooler. My PC is still virtually silent, and doesn't get real hot at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Bollman

customer_reviews.title: Smooth operator...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 12 of these and only one of them makes some noise. PRO: 1. Brand. 2. Colour is solid and I hope the LED's last a LONG time, pisses me off to no end when a LED burns out. CON: 1. Little expensive for what it is, I mean you get what you pay for, but,... 2. I wish the 140's come in sets or packs, that I saw. OTHER: Let's see how long they last and too bad one of them makes noise, so I'm going to have to some swapping out, as the one that makes noise is in MY PC, and not in one of my other PC's, i.e my server, or entertainment PC / server.
customer_reviews.author: Blaydese

customer_reviews.title: Good quiet fans
customer_reviews.text: These fans are nice and bright, definitely a good true blue. The clear blades look really great with the LEDs and overall the install was very clean and easy. They came packed together with everything required to install them into my case, fit perfectly, and are nearly silent. I'm sitting less than a foot from my case and I can't hear either of them running at all. If you want your rig to look like it's signaling the mothership and bright obnoxious LEDs are your thing, these are your fans. Would definitely buy again if I end up adding more fans to my case.
customer_reviews.author: Clever Naming Scheme

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 2 worked
customer_reviews.text: One of the fans won't turn right out of the box. Lights up but fan doesn't spin. 2nd fan works perfectly. Checked out wiring to cicuit board but I can't see any crossed leads. Likely theres a wire going to the motor from the circuit board that is grounding out. I had planned to run 4 of these but after this I think ill seek out another brand. Would have taken QC 2 seconds to test and see it wasnt working.... oh well.
customer_reviews.author: NLo63

customer_reviews.title: Good Airflow, Quiet, and Looks Nice
customer_reviews.text: I used a pair of these fans to add airflow to a gaming system in a thermaltake case, and these are a good fit, are quiet, and the illumination adds a degree of coolness. It comes with screws and the connector is the standard connector that all motherboards will have. All the "gaming" level boards from MSI/Asus/Gigabyte/ASRock/etc. will have several ports on the board for multiple fans. If you do not have any free ports, you will need to buy a fan power Y-adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: computer
customer_reviews.text: Great fans. Super quiet and the led's are super. Cooling ability doesn't seem to be a issue either for a gaming computer set up. I traded these 3 fans out for the Corsair liquid cooler non led fans. They work great under all stress conditions so far after 8 months of gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboybob

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Great fans for your build. I bought these over 3 years ago and still look and function great. Pros: Super quiet still Red LED looks amazing Great Airflow Good Value Cons: Dust magnets, you should clean these often if you are using an all-glass tower. Amazing, I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Precision

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect 30-50% Brightness (If that makes any sense hehe)
customer_reviews.text: When plugged into proper power they move a lot of air! If you're looking for something SUPER bright these ones are not for you. They give off a light that feels like it is 30-50% bright. This may only be helpful to people who use dim-able bulbs in their home, which is how I'm judging the brightness. Perfect for my use :)
customer_reviews.author: K. G.

customer_reviews.title: After putting these bad boys in I never have a single problem with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these fans altogether to put in my system. Before they were in, I had two standard case fans that came with the case and a corsair h60 radiator cooler with fan. My graphics card was hitting 80 degrees Celsius under load and I needed more air flow. After putting these bad boys in I never have a single problem with internal temps. I run my 1080 overclocked at max load and never see the temp over 75 degrees. Great price too. The only slight slight issue is that they are a little noisier than they claim to be. Still 5 stars though.
customer_reviews.author: PCEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: great case fans for exhaust or interior air flow.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these fans in my phanteks enthoo luxe case all working as exhaust. These fans are well made and really quiet. Even at max speed I can barely hear them. The airflow is decent at about 50 or so CFM. The are better suited for exhaust fans as they have higher air flow and lower static pressure. I have been running them for about 6 months now without a hitch. I will definitely be using more of these in future builds.
customer_reviews.author: Tech On the Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good fan for the price. Adequately quiet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good fan. It is certainly much quieter than the Sickleflow 120 fans which I earlier purchased. The original purchase was mainly driven by low price.... something that I am learning to avoid with regards to computer hardware. As the old saying goes, if you pay peanuts, you get monkeys. This fan is great. I use it alongside fractal design 140mm quiet fans in my Fractal design R5. LEDs look better too - due to the fact that the fan blades are semi-transparent white.
customer_reviews.author: abhijeet

customer_reviews.title: Moves air like a turbine, but quietly.
customer_reviews.text: These move a LOT of air. After letting my PC idle for a bit, the motherboard temperature sensors were reading at 28°C. LEDs could be a bit brighter, but hey, I bought these for the airflow.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cook

customer_reviews.title: These fans look great but quiet they are not
customer_reviews.text: These fans look great but quiet they are not. They are quite a bit louder than my fans that came with the case. One of the fans I had originally mounted horizontally, I had to remount vertically because it would rattle. These fans do create some good airflow and the red glow is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Poole

customer_reviews.title: First build
customer_reviews.text: Title says first build and it is so I don't have anything to compare these to but I'm guessing installation is pretty much the same across the board and it was easy enough. They do get a little loud when they're at full speed but for me that's not much of a concern but some would probably find it annoying. The leds work to my liking they're on the darker side though so if you're looking for room lighting brightness these aren't for you. With all the said they're case fans and they work.
customer_reviews.author: ImmortalDarkGoD

customer_reviews.title: Defiantly better than the 120's.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace the 120's of the same kind in my case as one of them became very noisy. These are much quieter and blow more air into the case. Love how the red lights are just bright enough but not too bright that they blind you if you have a windowed case. They are not the quietest fans on the market, but for the price they do an amazing job and thus far seem better built than the Air Series 120's I had.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: I now have 5 of these of my large case and the air flow is great. My case has a 3 speed case fan ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellently case fan. I now have 5 of these of my large case and the air flow is great. My case has a 3 speed case fan control switch. At low speed, these fans are barely audible and the air throughput is still great. The sound level is audible at max speed, but tolerable for me. I wear a headset most of the time so I do not care about case fan noise.
customer_reviews.author: BA

product_meta.title: Corsair Air Series AF120 LED Quiet Edition High Airflow Fan Twin Pack - Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BLUE| Size:120 MM| Style:DUALCorsair air Series AF120 LED quiet Edition high airflow fan twin pack - Blue
feature_bullets: Available in single or twin packs.
Air Flow Rate: 52.19 CFM; Operating Voltage: 7V - 12V; Speed: 1500 RPM

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars7,955 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
